main event: A series of unidentified flying object sightings were reported in Dayton, Ohio during 1957, with various observers noting multiple objects under different conditions.
interesting points: The first report indicated a single object tracked by ground radar flying east at 10-30 knots at 3000 feet., Eyewitness descriptions included an object that appeared brighter than Venus with a smoke or vapor trail., One sighting involved a USAF pilot observing a round-shaped object that emitted a bluish-white glow and made a sharp turn., Some witnesses described objects that were two in number, appearing yellow in color with no sound., There were distinctions made between objects classified as probably aircraft or astronomical phenomena.
sighted object: various unidentified flying objects exhibiting different characteristics
witness description: Multiple observers including pilots and civilians with different backgrounds.
